pullRequest.title: Flow HS changes for migrating swap endpoints

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -43,7 +43,8 @@
         CREATE("Flow creating"),
         UPDATE("Flow updating"),
         REROUTE("Flow rerouting"),
-        DELETE("Flow deleting");
+        DELETE("Flow deleting"),
+        SWAP_ENDPOINTS("Flow swap endpoints");

nodes.bodyText: nit: revertable otherwise it will be less readable imho
need more details on that validation logic, please leave a comment
Is "doNotRevert" flag applicable to all types of flow requests? If not, it makes sense to have a dedicated request class.
Why did we put this method in generic and shared FlowProcessingAction? It has a very specific use case - wrap the result of findPathIdsByFlowIds into a list for PCE.
hit: you can apply the annotation to the field instead.
So now, a FSM can log an history event with the taskId and flowId which don't belong to the FSM? Let's discuss this.

It's a really controversial solution - you allow overprovisioning for the sum of all flows' bandwidth for a single new path, but can't guarantee that this bandwidth will be release by those flows as they can have different paths.

beforeCommit.message:
Merge pull request #3377 from telstra/swap-endpoints/swap-endpoints-fsm

Added swap endpoints FSM in the Flow HS Topology.
